Order-now¶

/store/order-now

  • This URL gets hit when the user submits a form from /store/cart. A POST request is sent, and the forms consists of the following inputs.

Direct Order Form, Action: store:order-now¶

Fields

Input Type

Attribute

Product ID

Hidden

Required

User ID

Hidden

Required

Quantity

Hidden

Required

Response

  • Based on the input data, the server sends different responses. Using the django messages framework, a success message is displayed if the data is valid whereas an error message is displayed if the data is invalid. The product, quantity, and user are saved to the “Cart” model using the save() function and the user is redirected to the /store/checkout page.
